result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan J. Goetzke

records.addlTxt:
Status conference on May 1, 2023 at 09:00 am.

ALL PARTIES TO THE ACTION SHALL APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THIS HEARING.  THIS HEARING IS NOT BEING HELD VIA ZOOM.

3:12 PM Defendant Jonathan J. Goetzke appeared by video.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for Jonathan J. Goetzke.  Attorney Emily Hynek in court for State of Wisconsin. Tag case along with 19CF240 that is scheduled  5/2023

ADDRESS INFO for Jonathan J. Goetzke
Current: N3027 Clark Street, Humbird, WI 54746 United States  (Effective: 05-06-2022)
Prior: W8852 Decorah Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing time limits.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing within time limits.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Pre-trial conference on May 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. 
Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Juveniles 1, 2 and 3 referenced in the complaint unless Dept of Human Services can approve or arrange contact.
Entered in error. Defendant waived time limits. DOJ DNA Databank has been notified.

9:01 AM Defendant Jonathan J. Goetzke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron A. Nelson appeared by video for Jonathan J. Goetzke.  Attorney Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelson requesting speedy preliminary hearing. Requesting bond modification. State responds objecting to bond modification. Court: Bond reduced to $250 cash bond. Previous conditions remain. Defense now waives speedy request to prelim.   PTC set for 5/4 and STC set for 6/20 @ 3 PM.
